newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 22.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
A front-page editorial calls for China to carry forward the spirit of the Red Army's Long March to promote socialist ethics and spur on China's modernisation drive.
Premier Li Peng says the success of China's ambitious Three Gorges dam project hinges on the smooth relocation of local residents.
Visiting German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel and his Chinese counterpart Qian Qichen agree that Sino-German relations have returned to a normal, healthy track after months of tensions.
President Jiang Zemin meets with Colombian President Ernesto Samper and hails the smooth development of ties between the two nations.
The China Securities Regulatory Commission approves the merger of the Changchun United Commodity Exchange with the Beijing Commodity Exchange, the first-ever such merger.
